    • Constructor Detail

      • TheMovieDB

    • Method Detail

      • createAuthenticationRequest

        public AuthenticationRequest createAuthenticationRequest()
        This method is used to generate a valid request token for user based authentication. A request token is required in order to request a session id.

        You can generate any number of request tokens but they will expire after 60 minutes. As soon as a valid session id has been created the token will be destroyed.

        Returns:
        the request token

      • finishAuthentication

        public String finishAuthentication(AuthenticationRequest authenticationRequest)
        This method is used to generate a session id for user based authentication. A session id is required in order to use any of the write methods.
        Parameters:
        authenticationRequest - an authenticated authentication request
        Returns:
        the session id

      • getAccountInfo

        public AccountInfo getAccountInfo()
        This method allows you to retrieve the account ID along with some basic account information.

        The account ID is required to use any of the more specific account methods like grabbing a list of rated or favourite movies. A users password is never exchanged.

        Returns:
        the account infos

      • searchMovies

        public PaginatedResult<MovieExtended> searchMovies(String query)
        Searches for movies.
        Parameters:
        query - The query param is your search text. It works best when the text has been properly escaped. Hint, you can append a year to narrow your results.
        Returns:
        the search results

      • searchMovies

        public PaginatedResult<MovieExtended> searchMovies(String query,
                                          int page)
        Searches for movies.
        Parameters:
        query - The query param is your search text. It works best when the text has been properly escaped. Hint, you can append a year to narrow your results.
        page - Some searches will have more than 20 results, the default number of items returned per page. To iterate through use the page parameter.
        Returns:
        the search results

      • searchMovies

        public PaginatedResult<MovieExtended> searchMovies(String query,
                                          int page,
                                          String language)
        Searches for movies.
        Parameters:
        query - The query param is your search text. It works best when the text has been properly escaped. Hint, you can append a year to narrow your results.
        page - Some searches will have more than 20 results, the default number of items returned per page. To iterate through use the page parameter.
        language - It’s important to note that the language parameter acts as a filter for the title and poster field. This is to say, if you make a request for the German language, the original_title will always be returned but the title field will be empty if it hasn’t been translated. For posters, we’ll serve the German poster if available, otherwise default back to English. The expected value is a ISO 639-1 code.
        Returns:
        the search results

      • searchMovies

        public PaginatedResult<MovieExtended> searchMovies(String query,
                                          int page,
                                          String language,
                                          boolean includeAdult)
        Searches for movies.
        Parameters:
        query - The query param is your search text. It works best when the text has been properly escaped. Hint, you can append a year to narrow your results.
        page - Some searches will have more than 20 results, the default number of items returned per page. To iterate through use the page parameter.
        language - It’s important to note that the language parameter acts as a filter for the title and poster field. This is to say, if you make a request for the German language, the original_title will always be returned but the title field will be empty if it hasn’t been translated. For posters, we’ll serve the German poster if available, otherwise default back to English. The expected value is a ISO 639-1 code.
        includeAdult - You can toggle whether or not to include adult items in your search by using this parameter. The expected value is either true or false. When it is not specified, it is set to false.
        Returns:
        the search results

      • getMovieInfo

        public MovieDetailed getMovieInfo(int movieId)
        This method is used to retrieve all of the basic movie information. It will return the single highest rated poster and backdrop.
        Parameters:
        movieId - the movies id
        Returns:
        the movie details

      • getLatestMovie

        public MovieDetailed getLatestMovie()
        This method is used to retrieve the newest movie that was added to TMDb.
        Returns:
        the latest movie info

      • getMovieInfo

        public MovieDetailed getMovieInfo(int movieId,
                         String language)
        This method is used to retrieve all of the basic movie information. It will return the single highest rated poster and backdrop.
        Parameters:
        movieId - the movies id
        language - The language parameter tries to localize the movie data we return. If the language being requested does not exist, the value will be left blank. The expected value is a ISO 639-1 code.
        Returns:
        the movie details

      • getMovieCasts

        public MovieCasts getMovieCasts(int movieId)
        This method is used to retrieve all of the movie cast information. The results are split into separate cast and crew arrays.
        Parameters:
        movieId - the id of the movie
        Returns:
        the casts

      • getMovieImages

        public MovieImages getMovieImages(int movieId)
        This method should be used when you’re wanting to retrieve all of the images for a particular movie.
        Parameters:
        movieId - the movies id
        Returns:
        the movie images

      • getMovieImages

        public MovieImages getMovieImages(int movieId,
                         String language)
        This method should be used when you’re wanting to retrieve all of the images for a particular movie.
        Parameters:
        movieId - the movies id
        language - It’s important to note that the language parameter acts as a filter. This is to say, if you make a request for the German language, you will only get the images tagged as German back. If you want everything, simply omit the language parameter all together. The expected value is a ISO 639-1 code.
        Returns:
        the movie images

      • getMovieKeywords

        public MovieKeywords getMovieKeywords(int movieId)
        This method is used to retrieve all of the keywords that have been added to a particular movie. Currently, only English keywords exist.
        Parameters:
        movieId - the id of the movie
        Returns:
        the keywords

      • getMovieTranslations

        public List<Translation> getMovieTranslations(int movieId)

        Parameters:
        movieId - the id of the movie
        Returns:
        the available translations

      • getAlternativeTitles

        public List<AlternativeTitle> getAlternativeTitles(int movieId)
        This method is used to retrieve all of the alternative titles we have for a particular movie.
        Parameters:
        movieId - the id of the movie
        Returns:
        the alternative titles

      • getAlternativeTitles

        public List<AlternativeTitle> getAlternativeTitles(int movieId,
                                          String country)
        This method is used to retrieve all of the alternative titles we have for a particular movie.
        Parameters:
        movieId - the id of the movie
        country - The country parameter will filter the results to only include titles in that particular country. The expected value is a ISO 3166-1 code.
        Returns:
        the alternative titles

      • getSimilarMovies

        public PaginatedResult<MovieExtended> getSimilarMovies(int movieId)
        The similar movies method will let you retrieve the similar movies for a particular movie. This data is created dynamically but with the help of users votes on TMDb. The data is much better with movies that have more keywords.
        Parameters:
        movieId - the movie id
        Returns:
        the now playing movies

      • getSimilarMovies

        public PaginatedResult<MovieExtended> getSimilarMovies(int movieId,
                                              int page)
        The similar movies method will let you retrieve the similar movies for a particular movie. This data is created dynamically but with the help of users votes on TMDb. The data is much better with movies that have more keywords.
        Parameters:
        movieId - the movie id
        page - This method will try likely have more than 20 results, the default number of items returned per page. To iterate through use the page parameter.
        Returns:
        the now playing movies

      • getSimilarMovies

        public PaginatedResult<MovieExtended> getSimilarMovies(int movieId,
                                              String language)

This is to say, if you make a request for the German language, the original_title will always be returned but the title field will be empty if it hasn’t been translated. For posters, we’ll serve the German poster if available, otherwise default back to English. The expected value is a ISO 639-1 code.
        Returns:

      • getGenres

        public List<GenreSimple> getGenres()
        You can use this method to retrieve the list of genres used on TMDb. These ids will correspond to those found in movie calls.
        Returns:
        the genres list

      • getGenres

        public List<GenreSimple> getGenres(String language)
        You can use this method to retrieve the list of genres used on TMDb. These ids will correspond to those found in movie calls.
        Parameters:
        language - the langage as iso 639-1 code
        Returns:
        the genres list

      • getGenreMovies

        public PaginatedResult<MovieExtended> getGenreMovies(int genreId)
        If you're looking to get a list of movies per genre, you can look them up with this method. It is important to understand that only movies with more than 10 votes get listed. This prevents movies from 1 10/10 rating from being listed first and for the first 5 pages.
        Parameters:
        genreId - the genre's id
        Returns:
        the favorite movies

      • getGenreMovies

        public PaginatedResult<MovieExtended> getGenreMovies(int genreId,
                                            int page)
        If you're looking to get a list of movies per genre, you can look them up with this method. It is important to understand that only movies with more than 10 votes get listed. This prevents movies from 1 10/10 rating from being listed first and for the first 5 pages.
        Parameters:
        genreId - the genre's id
        page - This method will try likely have more than 20 results, the default number of items returned per page. To iterate through use the page parameter.
        Returns:
        the favorite movies

      • getGenreMovies

        public PaginatedResult<MovieExtended> getGenreMovies(int genreId,
                                            String language)
        If you're looking to get a list of movies per genre, you can look them up with this method. It is important to understand that only movies with more than 10 votes get listed. This prevents movies from 1 10/10 rating from being listed first and for the first 5 pages.
        Parameters:
        genreId - the genre's id
        language - It’s important to note that the language parameter acts as a filter for the title and poster field. This is to say, if you make a request for the German language, the original_title will always be returned but the title field will be empty if it hasn’t been translated. For posters, we’ll serve the German poster if available, otherwise default back to English. The expected value is a ISO 639-1 code.
        Returns:
        the favorite movies

      • getGenreMovies

        public PaginatedResult<MovieExtended> getGenreMovies(int genreId,
                                            int page,
                                            String language)
        If you're looking to get a list of movies per genre, you can look them up with this method. It is important to understand that only movies with more than 10 votes get listed. This prevents movies from 1 10/10 rating from being listed first and for the first 5 pages.
        Parameters:
        genreId - the genre's id
        page - This method will try likely have more than 20 results, the default number of items returned per page. To iterate through use the page parameter.
        language - It’s important to note that the language parameter acts as a filter for the title and poster field. This is to say, if you make a request for the German language, the original_title will always be returned but the title field will be empty if it hasn’t been translated. For posters, we’ll serve the German poster if available, otherwise default back to English. The expected value is a ISO 639-1 code.
        Returns:
        the favorite movies

        public PaginatedResult<MovieExtended> getNowPlayingMovies(int page)
        The now playing movie method will let you retrieve the movies currently in theatres.
        Parameters:
        page - This method will try likely have more than 20 results, the default number of items returned per page. To iterate through use the page parameter.
        Returns:
        the now playing movies

      • getNowPlayingMovies

        public PaginatedResult<MovieExtended> getNowPlayingMovies(int page,
                                                 String language)
        The now playing movie method will let you retrieve the movies currently in theatres.
        Parameters:
        page - This method will try likely have more than 20 results, the default number of items returned per page. To iterate through use the page parameter.
        language - It’s important to note that the language parameter acts as a filter for the title and poster field. This is to say, if you make a request for the German language, the original_title will always be returned but the title field will be empty if it hasn’t been translated. For posters, we’ll serve the German poster if available, otherwise default back to English. The expected value is a ISO 639-1 code.
        Returns:
        the now playing movies

      • getTopRatedMovies

        public PaginatedResult<MovieExtended> getTopRatedMovies()
        The top rated movie method will let you retrieve the top rated movies that have over 10 votes on TMDb. The default response will return 20 movies.
        Returns:
        the paginated results

      • getConfiguration

        public Configuration getConfiguration()
        Some elements of the API require some knowledge of the configuration data which can be found here.

        The purpose of this is to try and keep the actual API responses as light as possible. That is, by not repeating a bunch of data like image URLs or sizes.

        Returns:
        a configuration object

      • searchPerson

        public PaginatedResult<PersonSimple> searchPerson(String search)
        This is a good starting point to start finding people on TMDb. The idea is to be a quick and light method so you can iterate through people quickly.
        Parameters:
        search - The query param is your search text.
        Returns:
        the paginated search results

      • searchPerson

        public PaginatedResult<PersonSimple> searchPerson(String search,
                                         int page)
        This is a good starting point to start finding people on TMDb. The idea is to be a quick and light method so you can iterate through people quickly.
        Parameters:
        search - The query param is your search text.
        page - Some searches will have more than 20 results, the default number of items returned per page. To iterate through use the page parameter.
        Returns:
        the paginated search results

      • searchPerson

        public PaginatedResult<PersonSimple> searchPerson(String search,
                                         int page,
                                         boolean includeAdult)
        This is a good starting point to start finding people on TMDb. The idea is to be a quick and light method so you can iterate through people quickly.
        Parameters:
        search - The query param is your search text.
        page - Some searches will have more than 20 results, the default number of items returned per page. To iterate through use the page parameter.
        includeAdult - You can toggle whether or not to include adult items in your search by using this parameter.
        Returns:
        the paginated search results

      • getCompanyMovies

        public PaginatedResult<MovieExtended> getCompanyMovies(int companyId)

        companyId - the id of the company
        Returns:
        the searchMovies result

        Returns:

      • getPersonCredits

        public PersonCredits getPersonCredits(int personId,
                             String language)
        This method is used to retrieve all of the cast & crew information for the person. It will return the single highest rated poster for each movie record.
        Parameters:
        personId - the persons id
        language - The language parameter tries to localize the movie data we return. If the language being requested does not exist, the value will be left blank. The expected value is a ISO 639-1 code.
        Returns:
        the person credits
